jcr:content.jcr:title: Quiet Girl with a Credit Card

contentheadline.headline: Quiet Girl with a Credit Card

contentrichtext.text: {{Unreferenced|date=April 2008}} {{Infobox album <!-- See Wikipedia:WikiProject_Albums --> | Name = Quiet Girl with a Credit Card | Type = studio | Artist = [[Lisa Miller (singer-songwriter)|Lisa Miller]] | Cover = Quiet Girl with a Credit Card.jpg | Released = 1996 | Recorded = | Genre = [[Rock music|Rock]] | Length = | Label = W.Minc | Producer = [[Graham Lee (Australian musician)|Graham Lee]] | Reviews = | Last album = - | This album = ''Quiet Girl with a Credit Card'' | Next album = ''[[As Far as a Life Goes]]'' }} '''''Quiet Girl With A Credit Card''''' is the debut album from [[Australia]]n [[singer-songwriter]] [[Lisa Miller (singer-songwriter)|Lisa Miller]]. It was released in [[Australia]] in 1996 on the W.Minc label and licensed for release in [[Europe]] by [[Demon Records]]. Produced by [[Graham Lee (Australian musician)|Graham Lee]] (ex-[[The Triffids]]) who had previously played pedal [[steel guitar]] in Lisa's roots-rock band Truckasaurus. The album features Lisa's own compositions, plus two songs by Melbourne friends (one each from [[Dave Graney]] and [[Conway Savage]]), and two US classics: [[Bob Dylan]]'s "[[You're a Big Girl Now]]" and [[Dan Penn]]'s "Woman Left Lonely" (previously recorded by both [[Charlie Rich]] and [[Janis Joplin]]). ==Track listing== #"Big American Car" #"You're a Big Girl Now" ([[Bob Dylan]]) #"Guitar Boat" #"Nobody's An Angel" #"I'm Gonna Live My Life (I'm Gonna Take My Time)" ([[Dave Graney]]) #"Hang My Head" #"Woman Left Lonely" ([[Dan Penn]]/[[Spooner Oldham]]) #"False Waltz" #"Long Wide Load" #"Too Dark To See" ([[Conway Savage]]) #"Big Small Town" All compositions by [[Lisa Miller (singer-songwriter)|Lisa Miller]] except where noted. [[Category:1996 debut albums]] [[Category:Lisa Miller albums]] {{1990s-rock-album-stub}}
